name: Tomato Sauce With Capers and Vinegar
description: There are so many ways to enjoy this sauce. You can serve it with pasta or grains, over vegetables (try it with cauliflower) or on a bruschetta. I recently tried it with Israeli couscous, sautéed in olive oil then simmered in stock and topped with this sauce.
recipeYield: About 1 1/4 cups, serving four to six
recipeCategory: easy, quick, condiments, sauces and gravies
keywords: capers, sherry vinegar, tomato, healthy, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1 pound fresh tomatoes, grated, or 1 can chopped tomatoes
1 tablespoon capers, rinsed and finely chopped
1 tablespoon red wine vinegar or sherry vinegar (more to taste)
1 to 2 tablespoons minced parsley or slivered basil (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a medium heavy saucepan. Add the onion. Cook, stirring often, until tender, about five minutes. Stir in the garlic. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in the tomatoes, basil sprig, capers, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, stir and reduce the heat. Simmer 10 to 15 minutes until cooked down and very fragrant. Remove the basil sprig. Stir in the vinegar, the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the optional parsley or basil. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve hot or cold.
